meanings.definition: Occurring as a minor consequence or accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: The incidental noise from the street didn't bother me.
meanings.sent2: The incidental details in the painting added depth to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The incidental mix-up of the hats at the party caused some laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an incidental ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The incidental scent of fresh flowers filled the room with a pleasant aroma.

meanings.definition: Happening as a result of something else.
meanings.sent1: The incidental delay was due to heavy traffic.
meanings.sent2: The incidental meeting led to a new business opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The incidental spill of coffee on his shirt made for an interesting start to the day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an incidental effect of his silly joke.
meanings.sent5: The incidental discovery of the old book sparked her curiosity.

meanings.sent1: The incidental decorations at the party were nice but not necessary.
meanings.sent2: His role in the project was purely incidental.
meanings.sent3: The incidental absence of music made the event feel oddly quiet.
meanings.sent4: Her presence felt like an incidental part of the group.
meanings.sent5: The incidental error in the report was quickly corrected.
